newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian nuclear plant shut after internal leak.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian nuclear plant shut after internal leak.

text.p: Lithuania's huge Ignalina nulcear plant has closed down on after a reactor was shut on Tuesday, energy ministry officials said on Wednesday.
A leak was detected in the reactor's cooling system.
The incident meant the plant, which meets roughly 85 percent of the small Baltic state's electricity needs, was completely shut as a second reactor was undergoing routine maintenance.
"There was a minor leak in the cooling system of the reactor, but it had no impact on personnel or the environment," a senior ministry official told Reuters.
He added that the reactor would be restarted on September 3.
Lithuania's electricity needs are currently being met by the Elektrenai power plant, which burns heavy fuel oil.
Ignalina's two reactors are the largest of the infamous Chernobyl-style RBMK models operating in the former Soviet Union.
Some incidents in recent years, including a bomb scare in November 1994 and a fire in a turbine room last autumn, have raised concerns about safety at the plant.
